input: <web-search>What is the weather in San Francisco right now?</web-search>
output:
Based on the search results, here's the current weather in San Francisco:

**Current Conditions:** 50°F with mostly cloudy skies (as of January 21-22, 2026)

**Today's Forecast (Wednesday, January 21):**
- High of 56°F with cloudy skies
- Light and variable winds

**Tonight:**
- Low of 46°F, remaining cloudy

**Tomorrow (Thursday, January 22):**
- High of 57°F with cloudy skies early, then partial clearing
- Southwest winds at 5-10 mph

The weather is mild and typical for winter in the Bay Area.

Sources:
- [San Francisco Bay Area, CA - National Weather Service](https://www.weather.gov/mtr/)
- [National Weather Service Forecast](https://forecast.weather.gov/MapClick.php?lat=37.7771&lon=-122.4196)
- [San Francisco Weather Conditions - Weather Underground](https://www.wunderground.com/weather/us/ca/san-francisco)
- [San Francisco 10-Day Forecast - Weather Underground](https://www.wunderground.com/forecast/us/ca/san-francisco)
- [San Francisco Weather - WeatherBug](https://www.weatherbug.com/weather-forecast/now/san-francisco-ca-94103)

input: <web-search>What are the latest features announced for Claude in January 2025?</web-search>
output:
Based on the latest information, here are the key Claude features announced in January 2025:

## Healthcare and Life Sciences (Mid-January 2025)

Anthropic launched **Claude for Healthcare**, a major suite of healthcare-focused features:

- **Personal Health Record Integration**: Users can share access to their health records with Claude to better understand their medical information
- **Medical History Summaries**: Claude can summarize medical history and explain test results in plain language
- **Pattern Detection**: Analyzes fitness and health metrics to detect patterns
- **Appointment Preparation**: Helps prepare questions for medical appointments
- **Privacy Protection**: Health data shared with Claude is excluded from the model's memory and not used for training

## Other Recent Features (Late 2024/Early 2025)

### New Models
- **Claude Opus 4.5**: Anthropic's most powerful frontier model to date
- **Claude Haiku 4.5**: Fastest and most cost-efficient model, matching Sonnet 4's performance on coding, computer use, and agent tasks

### Skills and Integrations
- Enhanced **Skills** with integrations for workplace tools including Notion, Canva, Figma, and Atlassian
- Organization-wide management for Team and Enterprise plans
- New partner-built skills directory
- Open standard (Agent Skills) for easier skill development

### Memory Features
- **Memory capabilities** rolled out to Max plan users, with gradual rollout to Pro plans

Sources:
- [Anthropic joins OpenAI's push into health care with new Claude tools](https://www.nbcnews.com/tech/tech-news/anthropic-health-care-rcna252872)
- [Advancing Claude in healthcare and the life sciences](https://www.anthropic.com/news/healthcare-life-sciences)
- [Claude's New Features in 2025: A Game-Changer for Generative AI and Productivity](https://manalisomani099.medium.com/claudes-new-features-in-2025-a-game-changer-for-generative-ai-and-productivity-5a0ebbef2668)
- [Release Notes | Claude Help Center](https://support.claude.com/en/articles/12138966-release-notes)
- [Claude Desktop 2025: Key Updates & Comparisons for Devs and Teams](https://skywork.ai/blog/ai-agent/claude-desktop-2025-devs-enterprise-comparison/)

input: <web-search>Compare the current pricing of Anthropic's Claude API vs OpenAI's GPT-4 API in 2025</web-search>
output:
## Claude API vs GPT-4 API Pricing Comparison (2025)

Here's a breakdown of the current pricing for both services:

### **Anthropic Claude API Pricing**

**Claude 4.5 Series (Latest):**
- **Claude Haiku 4.5**: $1 / $5 per million tokens (input/output)
- **Claude Sonnet 4.5**: $3 / $15 per million tokens (≤200K context)
- **Claude Opus 4.5**: $5 / $25 per million tokens

**Long Context (>200K tokens):**
- Claude Sonnet 4.5: $6 / $22.50 per million tokens

**Cost Optimization:**
- Prompt caching: 90% savings on repeated context
- Batch API: 50% discount

### **OpenAI GPT-4 API Pricing**

**Current Models:**
- **GPT-4o**: $2.50-$5 / $10-$15 per million tokens (input/output)
- **GPT-4.1** (released April 2025): $2 / $8 per million tokens
- **Original GPT-4**: $30 / $60 per million tokens (legacy)

**Features:**
- Context: Up to 128K tokens (GPT-4o), 1M tokens (GPT-4.1)
- Batch API: 50% discount

### **Key Comparisons**

| Model Tier | Claude 4.5 | GPT-4 Series |
|------------|------------|--------------|
| Entry-level | Haiku: $1/$5 | GPT-4.1: $2/$8 |
| Mid-tier | Sonnet: $3/$15 | GPT-4o: $2.50-$5/$10-$15 |
| Premium | Opus: $5/$25 | Original GPT-4: $30/$60 |

**Overall:** GPT-4.1 and GPT-4o offer competitive pricing at the entry/mid-tier, while Claude Haiku 4.5 is the cheapest option for high-volume workloads. Claude Opus 4.5 provides premium capabilities at $5/$25, significantly cheaper than the original GPT-4's $30/$60.

Both platforms offer 50% batch API discounts and support for long context windows.

Sources:
- [Anthropic Claude Opus 4.5](https://www.anthropic.com/news/claude-opus-4-5)
- [Claude Pricing Explained: Subscription Plans & API Costs | IntuitionLabs](https://intuitionlabs.ai/articles/claude-pricing-plans-api-costs)
- [Anthropic API Pricing: Complete Guide and Cost Optimization Strategies (2025)](https://www.finout.io/blog/anthropic-api-pricing)
- [Claude Pricing: A 2025 Guide To Anthropic AI Costs](https://www.cloudzero.com/blog/claude-pricing/)
- [Claude API Pricing Documentation](https://platform.claude.com/docs/en/about-claude/pricing)
- [OpenAI API Pricing](https://openai.com/api/pricing/)
- [OpenAI API Pricing Documentation](https://platform.openai.com/docs/pricing)
- [AI API Pricing Comparison (2025): Grok, Gemini, ChatGPT & Claude | IntuitionLabs](https://intuitionlabs.ai/articles/ai-api-pricing-comparison-grok-gemini-openai-claude)
- [OpenAI GPT-4.1 Pricing (Updated 2025)](https://pricepertoken.com/pricing-page/model/openai-gpt-4.1)

input: <web-search>What were the major AI announcements at CES 2025?</web-search>
output:
Here are the major AI announcements from CES 2025:

## NVIDIA's Key Announcements

**NVIDIA** made several significant announcements, led by CEO Jensen Huang:
- **GeForce RTX 50 Series**: New GPUs built on the Blackwell architecture with major improvements in speed and efficiency
- **Project DIGITS**: A personal AI supercomputer bringing NVIDIA Grace Blackwell to developer desktops, capable of running AI models with up to 200 billion parameters
- **GB10 AI Superchip**: Designed to power AI applications and humanoid robots
- Partnerships with Kion and Accenture for AI-powered supply chain optimization, and with Toyota for next-gen autonomous vehicles

## Physical AI as the Dominant Theme

"Physical AI" emerged as the biggest buzzword - NVIDIA's term for AI models trained in virtual environments using synthetic data, then deployed as physical machines. Jensen Huang predicted "The ChatGPT moment for general robotics is just around the corner."

## Chip Announcements

- **AMD**: CEO Lisa Su announced new Ryzen AI processors for AI-powered PCs
- **Intel**: Unveiled Panther Lake (Intel Core Ultra Series 3) AI chip for laptops

## Robotics

**Boston Dynamics** (Hyundai-owned) publicly demonstrated its humanoid robot **Atlas** for the first time, with deployment planned for Hyundai's EV manufacturing facility near Savannah, Georgia by 2028.

## CES Foundry

CES officially opened its Foundry as the premier destination for AI and quantum breakthroughs, featuring live demos and immersive content.

**Sources:**
- [CES 2025: Jensen Huang Presents NVIDIA's Latest Innovations](https://www.ces.tech/articles/ces-2025-jensen-huang-presents-nvidias-latest-innovations/)
- [Artificial Intelligence - CES](https://www.ces.tech/topics/artificial-intelligence/)
- [Latest AI News and AI Breakthroughs that Matter Most: 2026 & 2025](https://www.crescendo.ai/news/latest-ai-news-and-updates)

input: <web-search>Find the latest documentation for the Model Context Protocol as of January 2025</web-search>
output:
The Model Context Protocol (MCP) is an open protocol that standardizes how LLM applications integrate with external data sources and tools. Here's what I found about the latest documentation as of January 2025:

## Latest Specification

The most recent MCP specification is dated **November 25, 2025** (version 2025-11-25), which marked the first anniversary of MCP with a major specification release.

## Key 2025 Updates

**June 2025:** Updates clarified authorization handling for MCP Servers and introduced Resource Indicators to help MCP Clients prevent malicious servers from obtaining access tokens.

**November 2025:** Introduced SEP-991, which added URL-based client registration using OAuth Client ID Metadata Documents. Clients can now provide their own client ID as a URL pointing to a JSON document that describes client properties.

## Official Resources

- **Main Documentation:** modelcontextprotocol.io
- **Latest Specification:** https://modelcontextprotocol.io/specification/2025-11-25
- **GitHub Repository:** https://github.com/modelcontextprotocol/modelcontextprotocol

The protocol is designed for building AI-powered IDEs, chat interfaces, and custom AI workflows by providing a standardized way to connect LLMs with the context they need.

## Sources:
- [Specification - Model Context Protocol](https://modelcontextprotocol.io/specification/2025-11-25)
- [GitHub - modelcontextprotocol/modelcontextprotocol: Specification and documentation for the Model Context Protocol](https://github.com/modelcontextprotocol/modelcontextprotocol)
- [MCP Docs – Model Context Protocol （MCP）](https://modelcontextprotocol.info/docs/)
- [Model Context Protocol (MCP) Spec Updates from June 2025](https://auth0.com/blog/mcp-specs-update-all-about-auth/)
- [One Year of MCP: November 2025 Spec Release | Model Context Protocol Blog](http://blog.modelcontextprotocol.io/posts/2025-11-25-first-mcp-anniversary/)
